title: Authors and Citation
text: Joseph Zemmels. Author, maintainer. Heike Hofmann. Author. Susan VanderPlas. Author. CSAFE. Funder.            Center Statistics Applications Forensic Evidence

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zemmels J, Hofmann H, VanderPlas S (2022). scored: Compute similarity scores cartridge cases. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {scored: Compute similarity scores between cartridge cases},   author = {Joseph Zemmels and Heike Hofmann and Susan VanderPlas},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Compute similarity between cartridge cases
text: R package compare cartridge cases compute similarity scores based breech face impressions.

title: Compute similarity between cartridge cases
text: can install development version scored GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("jzemmels/scored")

title: Compute similarity between cartridge cases
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(scored)  library(cmcR) library(impressions) library(tidyverse)  data("K013sA1") data("K013sA2")  x3pPlot(K013sA1,K013sA2) comparisonData <- comparison_cellBased(reference = K013sA1,target = K013sA2,                                        thetas = seq(-30,30,by = 3),                                        returnX3Ps = FALSE)  comparisonData #> # A tibble: 1,638 x 10 #>    cellIndex     x     y fft_ccf pairwis~1 theta refMi~2 targM~3 joint~4 direc~5 #>    <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>   #>  1 1, 2         24   -26   0.136     0.506   -30    2454   18481    2275 refere~ #>  2 1, 3         72   -37   0.148     0.388   -30    1150   16152    1109 refere~ #>  3 1, 4        -58     6   0.116     0.204   -30    1103   16846     531 refere~ #>  4 1, 5        -69   -25   0.209     0.431   -30    1450   19207    1351 refere~ #>  5 1, 6        -25   -13   0.294     0.519   -30    1751   21076    1336 refere~ #>  6 1, 7         33    15   0.234     0.483   -30    2401   22759    2101 refere~ #>  7 2, 1        -25   -49   0.161     0.550   -30    2498   17790      99 refere~ #>  8 2, 2          6   -63   0.134     0.176   -30     378   13973      54 refere~ #>  9 2, 3         40     8   0.174     0.602   -30    1912   13375       0 refere~ #> 10 2, 7         49    28   0.229     0.536   -30    2086   22466    1624 refere~ #> # ... with 1,628 more rows, and abbreviated variable names 1: pairwiseCompCor, #> #   2: refMissingCount, 3: targMissingCount, 4: jointlyMissing, 5: direction #> # i Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows comparisonData %>%   feature_densityBased_all(eps = 5,minPts = 5) #> # A tibble: 1 x 3 #>   thetaDiff translationDiff clusterSize #>       <dbl>           <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1         0            1.16          11 comparisonData %>%   feature_registration_all() #> # A tibble: 1 x 7 #>   ccfMean  ccfSD pairwiseCompCorMean pairwiseCompCorSD xTransSD yTransSD theta~1 #>     <dbl>  <dbl>               <dbl>             <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1   0.275 0.0853               0.546             0.151     35.7     32.3    17.1 #> # ... with abbreviated variable name 1: thetaRotSD comparisonDat_fullScan <- comparison_fullScan(K013sA1,K013sA2)  comparisonDat_fullScan %>%   feature_registration_all() %>%   select(ccfMean,pairwiseCompCorMean) #> # A tibble: 1 x 2 #>   ccfMean pairwiseCompCorMean #>     <dbl>               <dbl> #> 1   0.271               0.405

what:
Estimate the registration between two cartridge case scans using a cell-based
or full scan comparison procedure — comparison_cellBased
title:
Estimate the registration between two cartridge case scans using a cell-based
or full scan comparison procedure — comparison_cellBased
text: comparison_cellBased function uses cell-based comparison procedure implemented cmcR::comparison_allTogether(). comparison_fullScan estimates registration comparing full scans.

title:
Estimate the registration between two cartridge case scans using a cell-based
or full scan comparison procedure — comparison_cellBased
code: comparison_cellBased(   reference,   target,   thetas = seq(-30, 30, by = 3),   numCells = c(8, 8),   maxMissingProp = 0.99,   sideLengthMultiplier = 3,   returnX3Ps = TRUE )  comparison_fullScan(   reference,   target,   thetas = seq(-30, 30, by = 3),   returnX3Ps = TRUE )

title:
Estimate the registration between two cartridge case scans using a cell-based
or full scan comparison procedure — comparison_cellBased
text: reference x3p object target another x3p object thetas numeric vector arbitrary length containing rotation values considered registration procedure numCells numeric vector length 2 containing number cells divide c(rows,cols) cartridge case surface matrix . maxMissingProp maximum proportion missing values allowed cell/region. sideLengthMultiplier ratio target region reference cell side lengths. example, sideLengthMultiplier = 3 implies region 9 times larger paired reference cell. returnX3Ps Boolean return cellHeightValues alignedTargetCells cell index. Note setting argument TRUE required calculate visual diagnostic features

title:
Estimate the registration between two cartridge case scans using a cell-based
or full scan comparison procedure — comparison_cellBased
text: distinction "reference" "target" scans arbitrary, yet necessary keeping track comparison direction particular observation calculated.

title:
Estimate the registration between two cartridge case scans using a cell-based
or full scan comparison procedure — comparison_cellBased
code: data("K013sA1","K013sA2")  compData_cellBased <- comparison_cellBased(reference = K013sA1,                                            target = K013sA2,                                            thetas = c(-3,0,3))  compData_cellBased #> # A tibble: 234 x 12 #>    cellIndex     x     y fft_ccf pairwis~1 theta refMi~2 targM~3 joint~4 cellH~5 #>    <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <named> #>  1 1, 2        -44    23   0.192     0.521    -3    2454   19377    2245 <x3p>   #>  2 1, 3        -31    18   0.281     0.626    -3    1150   18225    1133 <x3p>   #>  3 1, 4        -32    15   0.386     0.707    -3    1103   20221    1016 <x3p>   #>  4 1, 5         30    -1   0.265     0.433    -3    1450   22308    1142 <x3p>   #>  5 1, 6          0     2   0.265     0.647    -3    1751   23429    1552 <x3p>   #>  6 1, 7        -50   -44   0.454     0.754    -3    2401   23848    2380 <x3p>   #>  7 2, 1         -8     0   0.171     0.605    -3    2498   18498    2171 <x3p>   #>  8 2, 2        -26    25   0.158     0.372    -3     378   15675     357 <x3p>   #>  9 2, 3        -30    21   0.142     0.503    -3    1912   16268    1880 <x3p>   #> 10 2, 7        -24   -26   0.352     0.642    -3    2086   23306    2000 <x3p>   #> # ... with 224 more rows, 2 more variables: alignedTargetCell <named list>, #> #   direction <chr>, and abbreviated variable names 1: pairwiseCompCor, #> #   2: refMissingCount, 3: targMissingCount, 4: jointlyMissing, #> #   5: cellHeightValues #> # i Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows, and `colnames()` to see all variable names  compData_fullScan <- comparison_fullScan(reference = K013sA1,                                          target = K013sA2,                                          thetas = c(-3,0,3))  compData_fullScan #> # A tibble: 6 x 12 #>   cellIndex     x     y fft_ccf pairwise~1 theta refMi~2 targM~3 joint~4 cellH~5 #>   <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>      <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <named> #> 1 1, 1        -14    -8  0.0955      0.140    -3  126310  159739  113854 <x3p>   #> 2 1, 1         -8     0  0.137       0.187     0  126310  159717  116953 <x3p>   #> 3 1, 1        -11    12  0.270       0.400     3  126310  159722  117849 <x3p>   #> 4 1, 1         12   -12  0.272       0.410    -3  123397  167983  119276 <x3p>   #> 5 1, 1          8     0  0.137       0.187     0  123397  167958  119212 <x3p>   #> 6 1, 1         14     7  0.0950      0.138     3  123397  167970  116030 <x3p>   #> # ... with 2 more variables: alignedTargetCell <named list>, direction <chr>, #> #   and abbreviated variable names 1: pairwiseCompCor, 2: refMissingCount, #> #   3: targMissingCount, 4: jointlyMissing, 5: cellHeightValues #> # i Use `colnames()` to see all variable names

what: Compare two cartridge case scans using the cell-based comparison procedure — comparison_cellBased
title: Compare two cartridge case scans using the cell-based comparison procedure — comparison_cellBased
text: Compare two cartridge case scans using cell-based comparison procedure

title: Compare two cartridge case scans using the cell-based comparison procedure — comparison_cellBased
code: comparison_cellBased(   reference,   target,   thetas = seq(-30, 30, by = 3),   numCells = c(8, 8),   returnX3Ps = TRUE,   maxMissingProp = 0.99,   sideLengthMultiplier = 3 )

what:
Compare two cartridge case scans by estimating the alignment of the full
scans — comparison_fullScan
title:
Compare two cartridge case scans by estimating the alignment of the full
scans — comparison_fullScan
text: Compare two cartridge case scans estimating alignment full scans

title:
Compare two cartridge case scans by estimating the alignment of the full
scans — comparison_fullScan
code: comparison_fullScan(   reference,   target,   thetas = seq(-30, 30, by = 3),   returnX3Ps = TRUE )

what: Calculate clusters using density-based clustering methods — densityBasedClusters
title: Calculate clusters using density-based clustering methods — densityBasedClusters
text: Calculate clusters using density-based clustering methods

title: Calculate clusters using density-based clustering methods — densityBasedClusters
code: densityBasedClusters(x, y, eps, minPts, method = "dbscan")

title: Calculate clusters using density-based clustering methods — densityBasedClusters
text: x tibble column containing estimated horizontal translations y tibble column containing estimated vertical translations eps double representing neighborhood radius used DBSCAN algorithm minPts integer representing minimum neighborhood size used DBSCAN algorithm method character vector specifies algorithm used find clusters. Must either "dbscan" "hdbscan" "optics" - see dbscan package information.

title: Calculate clusters using density-based clustering methods — densityBasedClusters
text: eps minPts arguments used differently depending method specified. eps argument passed eps parameter dbscan::dbscan function method == "dbscan" eps_cl parameter dbscan::extractDBSCAN function method == "optics"

title: Calculate clusters using density-based clustering methods — densityBasedClusters
code: data("K013sA1","K013sA2")  compData <- comparison_cellBased(reference = K013sA1,                                  target = K013sA2,                                  thetas = c(-3,0,3))  compData %>%   dplyr::group_by(direction,theta) %>%   dplyr::mutate(clust = densityBasedClusters(x=x,y=y,eps=5,minPts=5)) %>%   dplyr::summarise(clustSize = sum(clust > 0)) #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'direction'. You can override using the #> `.groups` argument. #> # A tibble: 6 x 3 #> # Groups:   direction [2] #>   direction            theta clustSize #>   <chr>                <dbl>     <int> #> 1 reference vs. target    -3         0 #> 2 reference vs. target     0         7 #> 3 reference vs. target     3        10 #> 4 target vs. reference    -3        12 #> 5 target vs. reference     0         7 #> 6 target vs. reference     3         0

what: Calculate features using density-based clustering algorithms — feature_densityBased_all
title: Calculate features using density-based clustering algorithms — feature_densityBased_all
text: feature_densityBased_all function calculates three density-based features one call. Calculate feature individually using feature_densityBased_thetaDiff, feature_densityBased_translationDiff, feature_densityBased_clusterSize functions. densityBasedClusters estimatedRotation functions exported helpers.

title: Calculate features using density-based clustering algorithms — feature_densityBased_all
code: feature_densityBased_all(   comparisonData_cellBased,   eps,   minPts,   method = "dbscan",   id_cols = NULL )  feature_densityBased_thetaDiff(estimatedThetas, direction, imputeVal = 180)  feature_densityBased_translationDiff(   x,   y,   cluster,   direction,   imputeVal = 1000 )  feature_densityBased_clusterSize(cluster, direction, imputeVal = 0)  densityBasedClusters(x, y, eps, minPts, method = "dbscan")  estimatedRotation(x, y, theta)

title: Calculate features using density-based clustering algorithms — feature_densityBased_all
text: comparisonData_cellBased tibble one returned comparison_cellBased() function contains results cell-based comparison procedure eps double representing neighborhood radius used DBSCAN algorithm minPts integer representing minimum neighborhood size used DBSCAN algorithm method character vector specifies algorithm used find clusters. Must either "dbscan" "hdbscan" "optics" - see dbscan package information. id_cols column names comparisonData tibble uniquely identify observation. returned along computed features direction tibble column containing characters "reference_vs_target" "target_vs_reference" specify comparison direction associated observation imputeVal value return feature calculation results non-numeric (.e., NA, NULL) value x tibble column containing estimated horizontal translations y tibble column containing estimated vertical translations theta tibble column containing estimated rotations

title: Calculate features using density-based clustering algorithms — feature_densityBased_all
text: eps minPts arguments used differently depending method specified. eps argument passed eps parameter dbscan::dbscan() function method == "dbscan" eps_cl parameter dbscan::extractDBSCAN() function method == "optics"

title: Calculate features using density-based clustering algorithms — feature_densityBased_all
code: data("K013sA1","K013sA2")  compData <- comparison_cellBased(reference = K013sA1,                                  target = K013sA2,                                  thetas = c(-3,0,3))  # calculate all density-based features in one call feature_densityBased_all(compData,eps = 5,minPts = 5) #> # A tibble: 1 x 3 #>   thetaDiff translationDiff clusterSize #>       <dbl>           <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1         0            1.16          11  # verify that we can calculate the same features using the individual #   feature_densityBased_* functions compData %>%   dplyr::group_by(direction) %>%   dplyr::filter(theta == estimatedRotation(x = x,y = y,theta = theta)) %>%   dplyr::mutate(clust = densityBasedClusters(x = x,y = y,eps = 5,minPts = 5)) %>%   dplyr::ungroup() %>%   dplyr::summarise(thetaDiff = feature_densityBased_thetaDiff(estimatedThetas = theta,direction = direction),                    translationDiff = feature_densityBased_translationDiff(x = x,y = y,cluster = clust,direction = direction),                    clusterSize = feature_densityBased_clusterSize(cluster = clust,direction = direction)) #> # A tibble: 1 x 3 #>   thetaDiff translationDiff clusterSize #>       <dbl>           <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1         0            1.16          11

code: feature_registration_all(comparisonData, id_cols = NULL)

title: Calculate all seven registration-based features — feature_registration_all
text: comparisonData data frame resulting comparison two cartridge cases (example, output comparison_cellBased comparison_fullScan functions) id_cols variable(s) group prior calculating summary statistics

title: Calculate all seven registration-based features — feature_registration_all
text: data frame containing seven registration-based features: 1. Mean CCF value 2. Standard deviation (S.D.) CCF values 3. Mean pairwise-complete correlation 4. S.D. pairwise-complete correlation values 5. S.D. horizontal translation values 6. S.D. vertical translation values 7. S.D. rotation values

title: Calculate all seven registration-based features — feature_registration_all
text: function can used comparison data full-scan cell-based comparison. full-scan comparison, recommend using average CCF average pairwise-complete correlation

title: Calculate a summary statistic of a variable at the estimated registration — feature_registration_summary
text: cellIndex tibble column containing cell indices direction tibble column indicating whether associated row came "reference vs. target" "target vs. reference" comparison fft_ccf tibble column containing cross-correlation function values summaryVar tibble column summarized summaryFun function used summarize values summaryVar column imputeVal value return case summary function results non-numeric (e.g., NA, NULL) value

title: Calculate a summary statistic of a variable at the estimated registration — feature_registration_summary

title:
Calculate features based on the cell-based or full scan registration
procedures — feature_registration_all
text: comparisonData tibble one returned comparison_cellBased() comparison_fullScan() functions contains results cell-based full scan comparison procedure id_cols variable(s) group prior calculating summary statistics cellIndex tibble column containing cell indices direction tibble column indicating whether associated row came "reference vs. target" "target vs. reference" comparison fft_ccf tibble column containing cross-correlation function values summaryVar tibble column summarized summaryFun function used summarize values summaryVar column imputeVal value return feature calculation results non-numeric (.e., NA, NULL) value

title:
Calculate features based on the cell-based or full scan registration
procedures — feature_registration_all
text: feature_registration_all function can used comparison data full-scan cell-based comparison. full-scan comparison, recommend using average CCF average pairwise-complete correlation.

title:
Calculate features based on the cell-based or full scan registration
procedures — feature_registration_all
code: data("K013sA1","K013sA2")  compData_cellBased <- comparison_cellBased(reference = K013sA1,                                            target = K013sA2,                                            thetas = c(-3,0,3))  feature_registration_all(compData_cellBased) #> # A tibble: 1 x 7 #>   ccfMean  ccfSD pairwiseCompCorMean pairwiseCompCorSD xTransSD yTransSD theta~1 #>     <dbl>  <dbl>               <dbl>             <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1   0.244 0.0856               0.546             0.171     30.8     28.8    2.69 #> # ... with abbreviated variable name 1: thetaRotSD  compData_fullScan <- comparison_fullScan(reference = K013sA1,                                          target = K013sA2,                                          thetas = c(-3,0,3))  feature_registration_all(compData_fullScan) %>%   dplyr::select(ccfMean,pairwiseCompCorMean) #> # A tibble: 1 x 2 #>   ccfMean pairwiseCompCorMean #>     <dbl>               <dbl> #> 1   0.271               0.405
